data.text: @MoseleyLabour Itâ€™s like you live in your own little world where you have contempt for the residents and businesses. You know better than us and give us what you think we should have rather than what we want. Unbelievable snobbery
@MoseleyLabour The parking spaces are already being used by paying customers and you want to drive them away again. What is wrong with you people?

@MoseleyLabour @patrickwillcock @KirstendeVos This is very welcome - as a @Co_wheels user, I'm really eager to see a car in Moseley along with some proper promotion. Car sharing is an important tool in taking cars off our streets and offering viable, affordable alternatives to car ownership. It needs leadership though.

@MoseleyLabour @Harborne_Jayne @PeterJFowler7 @PreetKGillMP now that Harborne high st has had the covid measures removed and been resurfaced, is a similar consultation going out all the residents of Harborne regarding permanent pavement widening and other active travel measures?

@patrickwillcock @KirstendeVos Agree and we are supporting Kirsten in this and have raised with the Cabinet member and have asked him to progress with his officers. We are also identified spaces that could be used and have passed this info over and will of course follow up.

@MoseleyLabour @KirstendeVos True but the Council says it is working with Co Wheels.  The Council have provided spaces for them outside the Mailbox so why not in Moseley. Why not just give your officers a nudge to ask Co Wheels if they would welcome a space? There is only so much Kirsten can do.
@patrickwillcock @KirstendeVos Hi Patrick, I know the Car Club is something @KirstendeVos is really keen to see in Moseley and she is sharing ideas.

@MoseleyLabour Are you planning to provide a parking space for a car club car in this redesign? @KirstendeVos It would seem like a great opportunity on top of the cycle lane you are hopefully putting in.
